{"step_by_step_thinking": "Spondylolysis is a common cause of low back pain in adolescents. It is a stress fracture in one of the vertebrae that make up the spinal column. Oblique views in radiography can help to visualize the pars interarticularis, the area of the vertebra most commonly affected by spondylolysis. Therefore, oblique views can add value in the diagnosis of spondylolysis in adolescents by providing a more detailed view of the affected area.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
